snippet: The White House distanced itself from a fruitless effort to train a Syrian opposition army to fight ISIS, but critics maintained the plan had been implemented poorly and too late.
abstract: News Analysis; Obama administration, after dismal report on United States' efforts to train Syrian force to fight Islamic State, claims it was always reluctant to do so; president is chided for passing blame to supporters of arming rebels, among whom there is little agreement on best response to increasing carnage in country's civil war.
lead_paragraph: The White House distanced itself from a fruitless effort to train a Syrian opposition army to fight ISIS, but critics maintained the plan had been implemented poorly and too late.

headline.print_headline: Finger-Pointing, but Few Answers, After a Syria Solution Fails
headline.main: Finger-Pointing, but Few Answers, After a Syria Solution Fails
